publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

supportDesc.foliation: There is foliation provided in the upper right corner of each folio.

layout.ab: Primary pricks are visible, horizontal pricks are visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling, the lower line is written above the ruling.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first giving the book to and second, receiving a gift of vestment and throne from .
A miniature of the art theme where successor falling and being smitten by for having touched gifts to Hildephonsus without permission.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the poor monk praying to carrying her Child; second, giving the poor monk garment and food.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode illustrating the worker standing next to , who performs a blessing gesture, while sitting on a throne and holding her son.

decoDesc.decoNote: A miniature of the art theme with one episode illustrating the worker standing next to , who performs a blessing gesture, while sitting on a throne and holding her son .

A miniature illustrating typically with as a sequence of three episodes/events, showing: first, the Jewish priest lying on the ground after his fall in the foreground of the miniature; second, sitting on a throne with the two deacons in the background and raising him by her hand; third, the Jewish priest standing before , who is sitting in the same position as in the second episode and performs a gesture of blessing .

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of two episodes/events, showing: first, Dǝmyānos writing the name of in a manuscript and second, Dǝmyānos lying down before the icon of Mary, performing a gesture of blessing. In the background, the pillar of gold, on which Mary inscribed Dǝmyānos' name is depicted.

decoDesc.decoNote: A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of three episodes/events, showing: first, the bishop ʾAbbās standing and distributing communion surrounded by the faithful, among whom is the woman who kisses his hand; second, the bishop sitting and cutting off his hand; third, the bishop and the faithful standing in front of the icon of the Virgin and Child, which has healed his hand .
A miniature of the art theme showing the monk Yǝsḥaq falling on the ground during the apparition of Mary, and the icon of taking Yǝsḥaq by the hand and raising him.
A miniature of the art theme typically showing standing next to Māryām of Dafrā and .

A miniature of the art theme typically in three episodes/scenes, showing: first, the painter sitting on a scaffold and drawing a scene; second, the painter falling down from the scaffold and third the icon of , who extends her hand to save the painter .

A miniature of the art theme typically in six episodes/scenes, showing, from the bottom left to the right the sick pilgrim lying in bed; the sick pilgrim standing before the places to which Mary carries him: in varying sequence Golgotha, Jerualem, the mount of Olives, Bethlehem and the Jordan. is standing in the middle .

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of five episodes/events, showing from the bottom left to the right: first, Zakāryās praying the greeting of the angel before the icon of : second, Zakāryās nailing down infront of the icon of: third, Zakāryās decorating the crown of with roses: fourth, who is sitting on a throne surrounded by angels and the five virgins (carrying roses) and collects roses out of his mouth and fifth, the thieves being consecrated as monks.

decoDesc.decoNote: A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of two episodes/events, showing: first, the two thieves attempting to eat the bread they stole from Yolyānā and Barbārā; second, depicts the two thieves standing before an icon of become monks. .

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of six episodes/events, showing: first, the three Arabs swimming in the water; second, one man being eaten by a crocodile; third, the two others standing on a rock above the water; fourth, one man riding a camel to the monastery, which is depicted in the background; fifth, the other man bringing his sheep's wool and sixth, the camel brought by the Arab eating from a tree.

A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of three episodes/events, showing: first, surrounded by the sleeping monks of the monastery, which is depicted in the background; second, the monastery with its monks that has been moved to the shore of the see; third, a group of people marvelling at the miracle.

A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of two episodes/events, showing: first, the priest Yoḥannǝs is depicted standing praying before the icon of the Virgin and Child; second, is taking out a breast and dropping her milk into the eyes of Yoḥannǝs and performing a gesture of blessing.

A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of four episodes/events, showing: first, the rich man from Qʷalāsis travelling with his companions on a ship; second, a four individuals from Qʷǝz piercing the eye of the nobel man: third, the rich man fallen after his eye has been pierced by arrows from the enemies:fourth, the rich man standing next to a small statue of himself in front of the icon of the Virgin and Child.

A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of four episodes/events, showing: first, the woman and her blind daughter standing praying before the icon of the ; second, both lying asleep before ; third waking up the girl, and fourth, giving sight to the blind girl by droping her breast's milk.

A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of three episodes/events, showing: first, the poor widow praying before the the icon of the , below which her three daughters are sitting; second, the funeral of the eldest daugher, who is wrappen in a shroud and surrounded by persons; third, the two other daughters standing next to the arborist man called Tewos.

A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of four episodes/events, showing: first, the two brothers sitting and writing next to each other; second, the demons hanging the soul of one of the scribes; third, pulling down the scribe's soul from the demons; fifth, the scribe sitting again and resuming his writing with his brother.

A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of two episodes/events, showing: first, lying in prison bound at his hands and feet, with a dove appearing to him; second, standing healed from his wounds.

A miniature of the art theme typically with as a sequence of three episodes/events, showing: first, the custodian of the church standing in front of the sitting Kaṭir ordering him to leave the church; second, sitting on a throne surrounded by two with the custodian of the church sitting before her; third, the healed Kaṭir standing before , who is sitting on throne and performs a gesture of blessing.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: Added elements on the first miracle
Added elements on the second miracle
Added elements on the third miracle
Added elements on the three miracles
Edited folio numbers and typo errors
Added elements on a hymn and images
